fields.title: Welcome Back to School!
fields.text: Welcome to the new school year! We're excited to have all our students and families back for another year of learning and growth. Please check your class schedules and remember that the first day of classes begins at 8:30 AM. We look forward to a wonderful year ahead!

fields.title: Parent-Teacher Conferences - Grade 1 & 2
fields.text: Dear parents of Grade 1 and Grade 2 students, our fall parent-teacher conferences are scheduled for November 5-7. Please sign up for your preferred time slot using the online portal. These conferences are a great opportunity to discuss your child's progress and set goals for the remainder of the semester.

fields.title: Science Fair - Grades 3-6
fields.text: Attention students in Grades 3-6! Our annual Science Fair will be held on December 10th in the gymnasium. Start thinking about your project ideas now. Project proposals are due November 15th. This is a great opportunity to explore your scientific curiosity and showcase your discoveries to the school community!

fields.title: Reading Challenge for All Students
fields.text: Our school-wide reading challenge begins Monday! Students who read 20 books by the end of the semester will receive a special certificate and pizza party invitation. Reading logs are available in the library and from your teachers. Let's make this our best reading year yet!

fields.title: Library Hours Extended
fields.text: Great news! Starting next week, our library will be open until 5:00 PM on weekdays to provide more opportunities for students to complete homework, use computers, and enjoy quiet study time. Students in grades 3-6 may stay after school with signed permission from parents.

fields.title: School Safety Drill Tomorrow
fields.text: Tomorrow at 10:00 AM we will conduct our monthly fire safety drill. Teachers, please review evacuation procedures with your students. All staff should be familiar with their assigned roles. The drill should take approximately 15 minutes. Thank you for helping keep our school safe.

fields.title: Halloween Costume Guidelines
fields.text: Students are invited to wear costumes to school on October 31st! Please remember: no masks that cover the face, no weapons (even fake ones), and costumes should be school-appropriate. We'll have a costume parade at 2:00 PM in the gymnasium. Parents are welcome to attend!

fields.title: Math Tutoring Available
fields.text: Free math tutoring is now available for students in grades 4-6 every Tuesday and Thursday from 3:30-4:30 PM in room 205. Students struggling with homework or wanting extra practice are encouraged to attend. Please contact me if you have questions about the program.

fields.title: Weather Policy Reminder
fields.text: As we head into the colder months, please remember our weather policies: school closes when temperature feels like -20Â°F or below, or during severe weather warnings. Announcements will be made by 6:00 AM on local radio stations and our school website. Please ensure your contact information is current.

fields.title: Book Fair Coming Soon!
fields.text: Our Scholastic Book Fair arrives November 12-16! Students will visit with their classes, and the fair will be open for family shopping on Thursday evening from 5:00-7:00 PM. Volunteer helpers are needed - please contact the library if you can assist. Let's promote literacy together!
